data.title: Cruella de Vil and other famous characters voiced by Alabama actors
data.meta_description: Did you know one of Disney's most famous villains, Cruella De Vil, was from the Alabama?
data.text:
Did you know one of Disney's most famous villains, Cruella De Vil, was from the Alabama? Although the 1961 film "101 Dalmatians" was set in London, the character of Cruella was voiced by Betty Lou Gerson, who was born in Chattanooga and raised in Birmingham.

Gerson, 1914-1999, always made a living from her voice, starting in the entertainment industry in the 1930s voicing characters on radio soap operas such as The Guiding Light and later voicing the narrator in 1950's "Cinderella." She also acted in a few films, most notably playing Nurse Andersone in 1958's "The Fly" starring Vincent Price, and the uncredited role of the old crone in 1964's "Mary Poppins."

But perhaps the most famous character she ever portrayed was Cruella de Vil, although few people recognized the real woman behind the wicked voice.

In a 1991 interview with the Los Angeles Times, Gerson said many people thought she was spoofing another Alabamian, Huntsville native Tallulah Bankhead, with her flamboyant portrayal of Cruella.

"We both had phony English accents on top of our Southern accents and a great deal of flair," she told The Times. "So our voices came out that way."

Gerson was honored as a Disney Legend in 1996 and made one last film, voicing Frances the Fish in 1997's "Cats Don't Dance."

Characters voiced by Alabama actors

Gerson is one of dozens of talented Alabamians who have lent their voices to well-known characters over the years. Although it would be impossible to list them all, here are some examples of Alabama voice actors. If you know of others you'd like to add to the list, email kkazek@al.com.

Pat Buttram, 1915-1994, Addison, Ala.

Known for his zany portrayals of western and country characters, Pat Buttram was a regular on TV's "Hee Haw" and was perhaps best known for playing Mr. Haney on "Green Acres." He also acted in a few films, including "Back to the Future Part III."

His voice acting included (but was not limited to):

"The Fox and the Hound," 1981, Chief

"Robin Hood," 1973, sheriff of Nottingham

"The Aristocats," 1970, Napolean

"The Rescuers," 1977, Luke

"Who Framed Roger Rabbit," 1988

"A Goofy Movie," 1995, Possum Park emcee

"Rugrats"

"Garfield and Friends"

George Lindsey, 1928-2012, Jasper, Ala.

Best known for portraying Goober on "The Andy Griffith Show," George Lindsey appeared on dozens of television shows and also acted in numerous films, such as "Treasure of Matecumbe," "Cannonball Run II" and "Take This Job and Shove It."

His voice acting work included:

"The Aristocats," 1970, Lafayette

"Robin Hood," 1973, Trigger

"The Rescuers," 1977, Rabbit

Glenn Shadix, 1952-2010, Bessemer, Ala.

Glenn Shadix was a prolific actor perhaps best known for his portrayal of Otho in 1988's "Beetlejuice." He also acted in "Heathers," "Demolition Man," "Dunston Checks In," 2001's "Planet of the Apes" and other films. He appeared on dozens of TV shows such as "Roseanne" and "The Fresh Prince of Bel Air."

His voice acting included, but was not limited to:

"The Nightmare Before Christmas," 1993, Mayor of Halloween Town

"Lilo and Stitch: The Series," 2003, Swirly

"The Little Engine that Could," 2011, Arkana

Beth Grant, born Sept. 18, 1949, in Gadsden, Ala.

Beth Grant is a prolific character actor who has been seen in "No Country for Old Men," "Rain Man," "Flags of Our Fathers," "Little Miss Sunshine," "A Time to Kill," "Speed" and many more. She also appeared on numerous television series, from "Murder, She Wrote," to "The X-Files."

Her voice work includes:

"Rango," 2011, Bonnie

"American Dad," animated TV series

Channing Tatum, born April 26, 1980, Cullman, Ala.

Channing Tatum has evolved into a true leading man, playing roles in "White House Down," "Magic Mike," "The Vow," "21 Jump Street" and "Jupiter Ascending."

His voice work includes:

"The Lego Movie," 2014, Superman (uncredited)

"The Simpsons" TV show

Octavia Spencer, born May 25, 1970, Montgomery, Ala.

Octavia Spencer is a prolific character actress who gained fame when she won an Oscar for her portrayal of Minny Jackson in 2011's "The Help." She has appeared in films including "A Time to Kill," "Never Been Kissed," "S.W.A.T.," "Drag Me to Hell," "Halloween II" and "Insurgent," as well as dozens of TV shows such as "The Big Bang Theory" and "CSI."

Her voice work includes:

"Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters," 2013, snake

"The Looney Tunes Show"

"B.O.O. (Bureau of Otherworldly Operations)," an animated film slated for release in June 2015 but was postponed.

Tony Cox, born March 31, 1958, raised in Uniontown, Ala.

Tony Cox is a character actor who played the preacher in "Beetlejuice" and appeared in films such as "Bad Santa," "Me, Myself and Irene," "Oz the Great and Powerful" and played an Ewok in "Star Wars: Return of the Jedi." He has also appeared on numerous TV shows.

His voice work includes:

"Strange Magic," 2015, elf

"Toy Story Toons: Partysaurus Rex," 2012

Courteney Cox, born June 15, 1964, in Birmingham, Ala.

Best known for portraying Monica Geller on the TV series "Friends" and Jules in "Cougar Town," Courteney Cox also has a successful career in films, including "3000 Miles to Graceland," "Ace Ventura: Pet Detective" and all four installments of the "Scream" series.

Her voice work includes:

"Barnyard," 2006, Daisy the pregnant cow
